title: Identifying Child Abuse and Neglect
headline: Gain insights into identifying and preventing child abuse and neglect with this free online childcare course.
description: International studies reveal that nearly three out of four children aged 2-4 regularly suffer from child abuse and neglect. However, this is preventable if you learn to recognise the signs and symptoms of child abuse and neglect, helping curb the adverse effects of this on the child and avert further damage. This course will equip you with relevant knowledge on identifying and reporting child abuse and negligence cases.
courseDescription:
This course will help you to gain a comprehensive understanding of child abuse and neglect. We will explore the first step in helping an abused or neglected child and different types of abuse. Possessing this knowledge will help you to quickly identify the kind of abuse and neglect the victim is undergoing to report such cases adequately. Next, you will learn to recognise the signs from the child, parents or guardian.

Did you know that chronic child neglect, which is less visible and often less sensational, is more pervasive and difficult to resolve? Find out about chronic neglect, how to work with families undergoing it, including critical factors of successful casework practices, examples of what agencies are doing and ways agencies can consolidate child welfare approaches to chronic neglect with prevention and early intervention efforts. We will debate the impact of physical, psychological, behavioural and societal consequences. In actuality, however, separating the types of effects is impossible. Physical consequences, such as harm to a child’s developing brain, can have psychological inferences such as cognitive delays or emotional difficulties. We will research the long-term consequences of child abuse and neglect.

Next, we will outline programs and strategies that are proving advantageous in reducing the possibility of child maltreatment. In addition, we will briefly identify critical issues facing child abuse and neglect prevention programs as they seek to broaden their reach and impacts. By completing this course, you will learn what child abuse looks like in real life and what caseworkers do to protect children by helping families develop healthier habits and behaviours. This course is ideal for everyone, especially professionals working in social services. So go ahead and enrol in this course today.
